newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - November 5.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - November 5.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sri Lankan press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Tamils students and teachers demonstrate against government closure of all Tamil schools in Vavuniya to house refugees from north.
Security forces arrest more than 100 Tamils in Colombo in search for Tamil Tiger rebels.
Twenty three Sri Lankan Tamil refguees land in Rameswaram in south India.
Bar Council meets on November 16 to discuss appointment of Professor Shirani Bandaranaike as Supreme Court judge.
Police chief disbands two anti-vice squads after they fail to achieve objectives.
Late president J.R. Jayewardene was master of state craft, opposition and United National Party leader Ranil Wickremasinghe says.

Colombo magistrate remands 11 soldiers suspected to have raped and killed teenaged Tamil girl in northern Jaffna. The suspects are also alleged to have killed the girl's mother, brother and neighbour to cover up the first murder.
Former president Junius Richard Jayewardene cremated at state funeral.
People's Alliance government has laid strong economic foundation the results of which people will realise in the next two years, President Chandrika Kumaratunga tells government parliamentary group.
